actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

actions.subcommittee: Domestic Monetary Policy, Technology and Economic Growth
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Domestic Monetary Policy, Technology and Economic Growth.
Mr. Bereuter moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2509.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 403 - 11 (Roll no. 67).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.

actions.committee: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs
actions.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Domestic Monetary Policy, Technology, and Economic Growth

committees.committee: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

official_title: To authorize the Secretary of the Treasury to produce currency, postage stamps, and other security documents at the request of foreign governments on a reimbursable basis.
short_title: Bureau of Engraving and Printing Security Printing Amendments Act of 2002

summary.text: Bureau of Engraving and Printing Security Printing Amendments Act of 2002 - Authorizes the Secretary of the Treasury to produce currency, postage stamps, and other security documents for foreign governments (subject to a determination by the Secretary of State that such production is consistent with U.S. foreign policy) on a reimbursable basis.

titles.title: Bureau of Engraving and Printing Security Printing Amendments Act of 2001
Bureau of Engraving and Printing Security Printing Amendments Act of 2002

To authorize the Secretary of the Treasury to produce currency, postage stamps, and other security documents at the request of foreign governments, and security documents at the request of the individual States of the United States, or any political subdivision thereof, on a reimbursable basis.
To authorize the Secretary of the Treasury to produce currency, postage stamps, and other security documents at the request of foreign governments on a reimbursable basis.
